nodes.desc: Accept user input for paths to t1 and t1 mask anatomical volumes. Used for all subject sessions
Accept user input for paths to white matter and cortical thickness surfaces
Downsample orginal t1 by a factor of 2 to the working space.
Downsample orginal t1 mask by a factor of 2 to the working space.
Apply downsampled mask to downsampled t1.
apply a registered mask to the functional image
create preprocessing and basic analysis pipeline for new fmri session.
get a masked functional image all sessions will preregister to

Use ITK-Snap to preform a course grain manual registration between the epi std rep volume and the downsampled t1, creating a crude linear mapping between the functional and working space. It is most important that the borders of the cortex closely match, since this map is used for  brain masking the epi rep.

Use ants coregistration to create a fine grained nonlinear mapping from the skull stripped manually aligned std epi rep to the downsampled t1. The manual registration got the brains as overlapping as possible, now this attempts to morph the cortex to correct differences in white matter boundaries due to field warp in epi acquisition.
invert the t1 mask to create a masked functional image
invert the t1 mask to create a masked functional image
dilate the downsampled t1 mask
Just a placeholder to tell the project manager that you created manual rois, and to provide instructions. You will need to draw and save the rois in freeview.
project ROIs defined on the surface back into the volume.
Combine time series created with different stimuli orderings via block of interest stacking method, then extract the average time course for each volume roi.
downsample volume rois by a factor of 2 to the working space.
transform directory of anatomical rois to functional space.
function that removes intermediate files associated with session. WARNING: This makes it impossible to re-run many intermediate processing steps without starting over.

Trains a GLM using all promoted runs. The resulting beta matrix is designed to capture the information we care about from this experiment, and satisfies the equation (DesignMatrix * hrf) @ BetaMatrix ~= EpiTimeSeries where * is the convolution operator and @ is matrix multiplication. We store the Betas in the GLM object, which also carries information about experiment design andvariance

Generates the contrasts requested in the paradigm definition using the subjet level beta matrix. Contrasts are a useful tool for comparing activation to two conditions or linear combinations of conditions on a per voxel level. Contrast values are interpreted as Z-scores here.
registers the contrasts to the anatomical space.
gets the beta matrix as a nifti from the GLM
